7951 min_capacity = min(capacity, min_capacity);
7952 }
7953 } else {
7954 /*
7955 * !SD_OVERLAP domains can assume that child groups
7956 * span the current group.
7957 */
7958
7959 group = child->groups;
7960 do {
7961 struct sched_group_capacity *sgc = group->sgc;
7962
7963 capacity += sgc->capacity;
7964 min_capacity = min(sgc->min_capacity, min_capacity);
7965 group = group->next;
7966 } while (group != child->groups);
7967 }
7968
7969 sdg->sgc->capacity = capacity;
7970 sdg->sgc->min_capacity = min_capacity;
7971}
7972
7973/*
7974 * Check whether the capacity of the rq has been noticeably reduced by side
7975 * activity. The imbalance_pct is used for the threshold.
7976 * Return true is the capacity is reduced
7977 */
7978static inline int
7979check_cpu_capacity(struct rq *rq, struct sched_domain *sd)
7980{
7981 return ((rq->cpu_capacity * sd->imbalance_pct) <
7982 (rq->cpu_capacity_orig * 100));
7983}
7984
7985/*
7986 * Group imbalance indicates (and tries to solve) the problem where balancing
7987 * groups is inadequate due to ->cpus_allowed constraints.
7988 *
7989 * Imagine a situation of two groups of 4 CPUs each and 4 tasks each with a
7990 * cpumask covering 1 CPU of the first group and 3 CPUs of the second group.
7991 * Something like:
7992 *
7993 * { 0 1 2 3 } { 4 5 6 7 }
7994 * * * * *
7995 *
7996 * If we were to balance group-wise we'd place two tasks in the first group and
7997 * two tasks in the second group. Clearly this is undesired as it will overload
7998 * cpu 3 and leave one of the CPUs in the second group unused.
7999 *
8000 * The current solution to this issue is detecting the skew in the first group
8001 * by noticing the lower domain failed to reach balance and had difficulty
8002 * moving tasks due to affinity constraints.
8003 *
8004 * When this is so detected; this group becomes a candidate for busiest; see
8005 * update_sd_pick_busiest(). And calculate_imbalance() and
8006 * find_busiest_group() avoid some of the usual balance conditions to allow it
8007 * to create an effective group imbalance.
8008 *
8009 * This is a somewhat tricky proposition since the next run might not find the
8010 * group imbalance and decide the groups need to be balanced again. A most
8011 * subtle and fragile situation.
8012 */
8013
8014static inline int sg_imbalanced(struct sched_group *group)
8015{
8016 return group->sgc->imbalance;
8017}
8018
8019/*
8020 * group_has_capacity returns true if the group has spare capacity that could
8021 * be used by some tasks.
8022 * We consider that a group has spare capacity if the * number of task is
8023 * smaller than the number of CPUs or if the utilization is lower than the
8024 * available capacity for CFS tasks.
8025 * For the latter, we use a threshold to stabilize the state, to take into
8026 * account the variance of the tasks' load and to return true if the available
8027 * capacity in meaningful for the load balancer.
8028 * As an example, an available capacity of 1% can appear but it doesn't make
8029 * any benefit for the load balance.
8030 */
8031static inline bool
8032group_has_capacity(struct lb_env *env, struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8033{
8034 if (sgs->sum_nr_running < sgs->group_weight)
8035 return true;
8036
8037 if ((sgs->group_capacity * 100) >
8038 (sgs->group_util * env->sd->imbalance_pct))
8039 return true;
8040
8041 return false;
8042}
8043
8044/*
8045 * group_is_overloaded returns true if the group has more tasks than it can
8046 * handle.
8047 * group_is_overloaded is not equals to !group_has_capacity because a group
8048 * with the exact right number of tasks, has no more spare capacity but is not
8049 * overloaded so both group_has_capacity and group_is_overloaded return
8050 * false.
8051 */
8052static inline bool
8053group_is_overloaded(struct lb_env *env, struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8054{
8055 if (sgs->sum_nr_running <= sgs->group_weight)
8056 return false;
8057
8058 if ((sgs->group_capacity * 100) <
8059 (sgs->group_util * env->sd->imbalance_pct))
8060 return true;
8061
8062 return false;
8063}
8064
8065/*
8066 * group_smaller_cpu_capacity: Returns true if sched_group sg has smaller
8067 * per-CPU capacity than sched_group ref.
8068 */
8069static inline bool
8070group_smaller_cpu_capacity(struct sched_group *sg, struct sched_group *ref)
8071{
8072 return sg->sgc->min_capacity * capacity_margin <
8073 ref->sgc->min_capacity * 1024;
8074}
8075
8076static inline enum
8077group_type group_classify(struct sched_group *group,
8078 struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8079{
8080 if (sgs->group_no_capacity)
8081 return group_overloaded;
8082
8083 if (sg_imbalanced(group))
8084 return group_imbalanced;
8085
8086 return group_other;
8087}
8088
8089static bool update_nohz_stats(struct rq *rq, bool force)
8090{
8091#ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
8092 unsigned int cpu = rq->cpu;
8093
8094 if (!rq->has_blocked_load)
8095 return false;
8096
8097 if (!cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask))
8098 return false;
8099
8100 if (!force && !time_after(jiffies, rq->last_blocked_load_update_tick))
8101 return true;
8102
8103 update_blocked_averages(cpu);
8104
8105 return rq->has_blocked_load;
8106#else
8107 return false;
8108#endif
8109}
8110
8111/**
8112 * update_sg_lb_stats - Update sched_group's statistics for load balancing.
8113 * @env: The load balancing environment.
8114 * @group: sched_group whose statistics are to be updated.
8115 * @load_idx: Load index of sched_domain of this_cpu for load calc.
8116 * @local_group: Does group contain this_cpu.
8117 * @sgs: variable to hold the statistics for this group.
8118 * @overload: Indicate more than one runnable task for any CPU.
8119 */
8120static inline void update_sg_lb_stats(struct lb_env *env,
8121 struct sched_group *group, int load_idx,
8122 int local_group, struct sg_lb_stats *sgs,
8123 bool *overload)
8124{
8125 unsigned long load;
8126 int i, nr_running;
8127
8128 memset(sgs, 0, sizeof(*sgs));
8129
8130 for_each_cpu_and(i, sched_group_span(group), env->cpus) {
8131 struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(i);
8132
8133 if ((env->flags & LBF_NOHZ_STATS) && update_nohz_stats(rq, false))
8134 env->flags |= LBF_NOHZ_AGAIN;
8135
8136 /* Bias balancing toward CPUs of our domain: */
8137 if (local_group)
8138 load = target_load(i, load_idx);
8139 else
8140 load = source_load(i, load_idx);
8141
8142 sgs->group_load += load;
8143 sgs->group_util += cpu_util(i);
8144 sgs->sum_nr_running += rq->cfs.h_nr_running;
8145
8146 nr_running = rq->nr_running;
8147 if (nr_running > 1)
8148 *overload = true;
8149
8150#ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
8151 sgs->nr_numa_running += rq->nr_numa_running;
8152 sgs->nr_preferred_running += rq->nr_preferred_running;
8153#endif
8154 sgs->sum_weighted_load += weighted_cpuload(rq);
8155 /*
8156 * No need to call idle_cpu() if nr_running is not 0
8157 */
8158 if (!nr_running && idle_cpu(i))
8159 sgs->idle_cpus++;
8160 }
8161
8162 /* Adjust by relative CPU capacity of the group */
8163 sgs->group_capacity = group->sgc->capacity;
8164 sgs->avg_load = (sgs->group_load*SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) / sgs->group_capacity;
8165
8166 if (sgs->sum_nr_running)
8167 sgs->load_per_task = sgs->sum_weighted_load / sgs->sum_nr_running;
8168
8169 sgs->group_weight = group->group_weight;
8170
8171 sgs->group_no_capacity = group_is_overloaded(env, sgs);
8172 sgs->group_type = group_classify(group, sgs);
8173}
8174
8175/**
8176 * update_sd_pick_busiest - return 1 on busiest group
8177 * @env: The load balancing environment.
8178 * @sds: sched_domain statistics
8179 * @sg: sched_group candidate to be checked for being the busiest
8180 * @sgs: sched_group statistics
8181 *
8182 * Determine if @sg is a busier group than the previously selected
8183 * busiest group.
8184 *
8185 * Return: %true if @sg is a busier group than the previously selected
8186 * busiest group. %false otherwise.
8187 */
8188static bool update_sd_pick_busiest(struct lb_env *env,
8189 struct sd_lb_stats *sds,
8190 struct sched_group *sg,
8191 struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8192{
8193 struct sg_lb_stats *busiest = &sds->busiest_stat;
8194
8195 if (sgs->group_type > busiest->group_type)
8196 return true;
8197
8198 if (sgs->group_type < busiest->group_type)
8199 return false;
8200
8201 if (sgs->avg_load <= busiest->avg_load)
8202 return false;
8203
8204 if (!(env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_CPUCAPACITY))
8205 goto asym_packing;
8206
8207 /*
8208 * Candidate sg has no more than one task per CPU and
8209 * has higher per-CPU capacity. Migrating tasks to less
8210 * capable CPUs may harm throughput. Maximize throughput,
8211 * power/energy consequences are not considered.
8212 */
8213 if (sgs->sum_nr_running <= sgs->group_weight &&
8214 group_smaller_cpu_capacity(sds->local, sg))
8215 return false;
8216
8217asym_packing:
8218 /* This is the busiest node in its class. */
8219 if (!(env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_PACKING))
8220 return true;
8221
8222 /* No ASYM_PACKING if target CPU is already busy */
8223 if (env->idle == CPU_NOT_IDLE)
8224 return true;
8225 /*
8226 * ASYM_PACKING needs to move all the work to the highest
8227 * prority CPUs in the group, therefore mark all groups
8228 * of lower priority than ourself as busy.
8229 */
8230 if (sgs->sum_nr_running &&
8231 sched_asym_prefer(env->dst_cpu, sg->asym_prefer_cpu)) {
8232 if (!sds->busiest)
8233 return true;
8234
8235 /* Prefer to move from lowest priority CPU's work */
8236 if (sched_asym_prefer(sds->busiest->asym_prefer_cpu,
8237 sg->asym_prefer_cpu))
8238 return true;
8239 }
8240
8241 return false;
8242}
8243
8244#ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
8245static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_group(struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8246{
8247 if (sgs->sum_nr_running > sgs->nr_numa_running)
8248 return regular;
8249 if (sgs->sum_nr_running > sgs->nr_preferred_running)
8250 return remote;
8251 return all;
8252}
8253
8254static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_rq(struct rq *rq)
8255{
8256 if (rq->nr_running > rq->nr_numa_running)
8257 return regular;
8258 if (rq->nr_running > rq->nr_preferred_running)
8259 return remote;
8260 return all;
8261}
8262#else
8263static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_group(struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8264{
8265 return all;
8266}
8267
8268static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_rq(struct rq *rq)
8269{
8270 return regular;
8271}
8272#endif /* CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING */
8273
8274/**
8275 * update_sd_lb_stats - Update sched_domain's statistics for load balancing.
8276 * @env: The load balancing environment.
8277 * @sds: variable to hold the statistics for this sched_domain.
8278 */
8279static inline void update_sd_lb_stats(struct lb_env *env, struct sd_lb_stats *sds)
8280{
8281 struct sched_domain *child = env->sd->child;
8282 struct sched_group *sg = env->sd->groups;
8283 struct sg_lb_stats *local = &sds->local_stat;
8284 struct sg_lb_stats tmp_sgs;
8285 int load_idx, prefer_sibling = 0;
8286 bool overload = false;
8287
8288 if (child && child->flags & SD_PREFER_SIBLING)
8289 prefer_sibling = 1;
8290
8291#ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
8292 if (env->idle == CPU_NEWLY_IDLE && READ_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked))
8293 env->flags |= LBF_NOHZ_STATS;
8294#endif
8295
8296 load_idx = get_sd_load_idx(env->sd, env->idle);
8297
8298 do {
8299 struct sg_lb_stats *sgs = &tmp_sgs;
8300 int local_group;
8301
8302 local_group = cpumask_test_cpu(env->dst_cpu, sched_group_span(sg));
8303 if (local_group) {
8304 sds->local = sg;
8305 sgs = local;
8306
8307 if (env->idle != CPU_NEWLY_IDLE ||
8308 time_after_eq(jiffies, sg->sgc->next_update))
8309 update_group_capacity(env->sd, env->dst_cpu);
8310 }
8311
8312 update_sg_lb_stats(env, sg, load_idx, local_group, sgs,
8313 &overload);
8314
8315 if (local_group)
8316 goto next_group;
8317
8318 /*
8319 * In case the child domain prefers tasks go to siblings
8320 * first, lower the sg capacity so that we'll try
8321 * and move all the excess tasks away. We lower the capacity
8322 * of a group only if the local group has the capacity to fit
8323 * these excess tasks. The extra check prevents the case where
8324 * you always pull from the heaviest group when it is already
8325 * under-utilized (possible with a large weight task outweighs
8326 * the tasks on the system).
8327 */
8328 if (prefer_sibling && sds->local &&
8329 group_has_capacity(env, local) &&
8330 (sgs->sum_nr_running > local->sum_nr_running + 1)) {
8331 sgs->group_no_capacity = 1;
8332 sgs->group_type = group_classify(sg, sgs);
8333 }
8334
8335 if (update_sd_pick_busiest(env, sds, sg, sgs)) {
8336 sds->busiest = sg;
8337 sds->busiest_stat = *sgs;
8338 }
8339
8340next_group:
8341 /* Now, start updating sd_lb_stats */
8342 sds->total_running += sgs->sum_nr_running;
8343 sds->total_load += sgs->group_load;
8344 sds->total_capacity += sgs->group_capacity;
8345
8346 sg = sg->next;
8347 } while (sg != env->sd->groups);
8348
8349#ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
8350 if ((env->flags & LBF_NOHZ_AGAIN) &&
8351 cpumask_subset(nohz.idle_cpus_mask, sched_domain_span(env->sd))) {
8352
8353 WRITE_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked,
8354 jiffies + msecs_to_jiffies(LOAD_AVG_PERIOD));
8355 }
8356#endif
8357
8358 if (env->sd->flags & SD_NUMA)
8359 env->fbq_type = fbq_classify_group(&sds->busiest_stat);
8360
8361 if (!env->sd->parent) {
8362 /* update overload indicator if we are at root domain */
8363 if (env->dst_rq->rd->overload != overload)
8364 env->dst_rq->rd->overload = overload;
8365 }
8366}
8367
8368/**
8369 * check_asym_packing - Check to see if the group is packed into the
8370 * sched domain.
8371 *
8372 * This is primarily intended to used at the sibling level. Some
8373 * cores like POWER7 prefer to use lower numbered SMT threads. In the
8374 * case of POWER7, it can move to lower SMT modes only when higher
8375 * threads are idle. When in lower SMT modes, the threads will
8376 * perform better since they share less core resources. Hence when we
8377 * have idle threads, we want them to be the higher ones.
8378 *
8379 * This packing function is run on idle threads. It checks to see if
8380 * the busiest CPU in this domain (core in the P7 case) has a higher
8381 * CPU number than the packing function is being run on. Here we are
8382 * assuming lower CPU number will be equivalent to lower a SMT thread
8383 * number.
8384 *
8385 * Return: 1 when packing is required and a task should be moved to
8386 * this CPU. The amount of the imbalance is returned in env->imbalance.
8387 *
8388 * @env: The load balancing environment.
8389 * @sds: Statistics of the sched_domain which is to be packed
8390 */
8391static int check_asym_packing(struct lb_env *env, struct sd_lb_stats *sds)
8392{
8393 int busiest_cpu;
8394
8395 if (!(env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_PACKING))
8396 return 0;
8397
8398 if (env->idle == CPU_NOT_IDLE)
8399 return 0;
8400
8401 if (!sds->busiest)
8402 return 0;
8403
8404 busiest_cpu = sds->busiest->asym_prefer_cpu;
8405 if (sched_asym_prefer(busiest_cpu, env->dst_cpu))
8406 return 0;
8407
8408 env->imbalance = DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST(
8409 sds->busiest_stat.avg_load * sds->busiest_stat.group_capacity,
8410 SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE);
8411
8412 return 1;
8413}
8414
8415/**
8416 * fix_small_imbalance - Calculate the minor imbalance that exists
8417 * amongst the groups of a sched_domain, during
8418 * load balancing.
8419 * @env: The load balancing environment.
8420 * @sds: Statistics of the sched_domain whose imbalance is to be calculated.
8421 */
8422static inline
8423void fix_small_imbalance(struct lb_env *env, struct sd_lb_stats *sds)
8424{
8425 unsigned long tmp, capa_now = 0, capa_move = 0;
8426 unsigned int imbn = 2;
8427 unsigned long scaled_busy_load_per_task;
8428 struct sg_lb_stats *local, *busiest;
8429
8430 local = &sds->local_stat;
8431 busiest = &sds->busiest_stat;
8432
8433 if (!local->sum_nr_running)
8434 local->load_per_task = cpu_avg_load_per_task(env->dst_cpu);
8435 else if (busiest->load_per_task > local->load_per_task)
8436 imbn = 1;
8437
8438 scaled_busy_load_per_task =
8439 (busiest->load_per_task * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) /
8440 busiest->group_capacity;
8441
8442 if (busiest->avg_load + scaled_busy_load_per_task >=
8443 local->avg_load + (scaled_busy_load_per_task * imbn)) {
8444 env->imbalance = busiest->load_per_task;
8445 return;
8446 }
8447
8448 /*
8449 * OK, we don't have enough imbalance to justify moving tasks,
8450 * however we may be able to increase total CPU capacity used by
8451 * moving them.
8452 */
8453
8454 capa_now += busiest->group_capacity *
8455 min(busiest->load_per_task, busiest->avg_load);
8456 capa_now += local->group_capacity *
8457 min(local->load_per_task, local->avg_load);
8458 capa_now /= SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE;
8459
8460 /* Amount of load we'd subtract */
8461 if (busiest->avg_load > scaled_busy_load_per_task) {
8462 capa_move += busiest->group_capacity *
8463 min(busiest->load_per_task,
8464 busiest->avg_load - scaled_busy_load_per_task);
8465 }
8466
8467 /* Amount of load we'd add */
8468 if (busiest->avg_load * busiest->group_capacity <
8469 busiest->load_per_task * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) {
8470 tmp = (busiest->avg_load * busiest->group_capacity) /
8471 local->group_capacity;
8472 } else {
8473 tmp = (busiest->load_per_task * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) /
8474 local->group_capacity;
8475 }
8476 capa_move += local->group_capacity *
8477 min(local->load_per_task, local->avg_load + tmp);
8478 capa_move /= SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE;
8479
8480 /* Move if we gain throughput */
8481 if (capa_move > capa_now)
8482 env->imbalance = busiest->load_per_task;
8483}
8484
8485/**
8486 * calculate_imbalance - Calculate the amount of imbalance present within the
8487 * groups of a given sched_domain during load balance.
8488 * @env: load balance environment
8489 * @sds: statistics of the sched_domain whose imbalance is to be calculated.
8490 */
8491static inline void calculate_imbalance(struct lb_env *env, struct sd_lb_stats *sds)
8492{
8493 unsigned long max_pull, load_above_capacity = ~0UL;
8494 struct sg_lb_stats *local, *busiest;
8495
8496 local = &sds->local_stat;
8497 busiest = &sds->busiest_stat;
8498
8499 if (busiest->group_type == group_imbalanced) {
8500 /*
8501 * In the group_imb case we cannot rely on group-wide averages
8502 * to ensure CPU-load equilibrium, look at wider averages. XXX
8503 */
8504 busiest->load_per_task =
8505 min(busiest->load_per_task, sds->avg_load);
8506 }
8507
8508 /*
8509 * Avg load of busiest sg can be less and avg load of local sg can
8510 * be greater than avg load across all sgs of sd because avg load
8511 * factors in sg capacity and sgs with smaller group_type are
8512 * skipped when updating the busiest sg:
8513 */
8514 if (busiest->avg_load <= sds->avg_load ||
8515 local->avg_load >= sds->avg_load) {
8516 env->imbalance = 0;
8517 return fix_small_imbalance(env, sds);
8518 }
8519
8520 /*
8521 * If there aren't any idle CPUs, avoid creating some.
8522 */
8523 if (busiest->group_type == group_overloaded &&
8524 local->group_type == group_overloaded) {
8525 load_above_capacity = busiest->sum_nr_running * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE;
8526 if (load_above_capacity > busiest->group_capacity) {
8527 load_above_capacity -= busiest->group_capacity;
8528 load_above_capacity *= scale_load_down(NICE_0_LOAD);
8529 load_above_capacity /= busiest->group_capacity;
8530 } else
8531 load_above_capacity = ~0UL;
8532 }
8533
8534 /*
8535 * We're trying to get all the CPUs to the average_load, so we don't
8536 * want to push ourselves above the average load, nor do we wish to
8537 * reduce the max loaded CPU below the average load. At the same time,
8538 * we also don't want to reduce the group load below the group
8539 * capacity. Thus we look for the minimum possible imbalance.
8540 */
8541 max_pull = min(busiest->avg_load - sds->avg_load, load_above_capacity);
8542
8543 /* How much load to actually move to equalise the imbalance */
8544 env->imbalance = min(
8545 max_pull * busiest->group_capacity,
8546 (sds->avg_load - local->avg_load) * local->group_capacity
8547 ) / SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE;
8548
8549 /*
8550 * if *imbalance is less than the average load per runnable task
8551 * there is no guarantee that any tasks will be moved so we'll have
8552 * a think about bumping its value to force at least one task to be
8553 * moved
8554 */
8555 if (env->imbalance < busiest->load_per_task)
8556 return fix_small_imbalance(env, sds);
8557}
8558
8559/******* find_busiest_group() helpers end here *********************/
8560
8561/**
8562 * find_busiest_group - Returns the busiest group within the sched_domain
8563 * if there is an imbalance.
8564 *
8565 * Also calculates the amount of weighted load which should be moved
8566 * to restore balance.
8567 *
8568 * @env: The load balancing environment.
8569 *
8570 * Return: - The busiest group if imbalance exists.
8571 */
8572static struct sched_group *find_busiest_group(struct lb_env *env)
8573{
8574 struct sg_lb_stats *local, *busiest;
8575 struct sd_lb_stats sds;
8576
8577 init_sd_lb_stats(&sds);
8578
8579 /*
8580 * Compute the various statistics relavent for load balancing at
8581 * this level.
8582 */
8583 update_sd_lb_stats(env, &sds);
8584 local = &sds.local_stat;
8585 busiest = &sds.busiest_stat;
8586
8587 /* ASYM feature bypasses nice load balance check */
8588 if (check_asym_packing(env, &sds))
8589 return sds.busiest;
8590
8591 /* There is no busy sibling group to pull tasks from */
8592 if (!sds.busiest || busiest->sum_nr_running == 0)
8593 goto out_balanced;
8594
8595 /* XXX broken for overlapping NUMA groups */
8596 sds.avg_load = (SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE * sds.total_load)
8597 / sds.total_capacity;
8598
8599 /*
8600 * If the busiest group is imbalanced the below checks don't
8601 * work because they assume all things are equal, which typically
8602 * isn't true due to cpus_allowed constraints and the like.
8603 */
8604 if (busiest->group_type == group_imbalanced)
8605 goto force_balance;
8606
8607 /*
8608 * When dst_cpu is idle, prevent SMP nice and/or asymmetric group
8609 * capacities from resulting in underutilization due to avg_load.
8610 */
8611 if (env->idle != CPU_NOT_IDLE && group_has_capacity(env, local) &&
8612 busiest->group_no_capacity)
8613 goto force_balance;
8614
8615 /*
8616 * If the local group is busier than the selected busiest group
8617 * don't try and pull any tasks.
8618 */
8619 if (local->avg_load >= busiest->avg_load)
8620 goto out_balanced;
8621
8622 /*
8623 * Don't pull any tasks if this group is already above the domain
8624 * average load.
8625 */
8626 if (local->avg_load >= sds.avg_load)
8627 goto out_balanced;
8628
8629 if (env->idle == CPU_IDLE) {
8630 /*
8631 * This CPU is idle. If the busiest group is not overloaded
8632 * and there is no imbalance between this and busiest group
8633 * wrt idle CPUs, it is balanced. The imbalance becomes
8634 * significant if the diff is greater than 1 otherwise we
8635 * might end up to just move the imbalance on another group
8636 */
8637 if ((busiest->group_type != group_overloaded) &&
8638 (local->idle_cpus <= (busiest->idle_cpus + 1)))
8639 goto out_balanced;
8640 } else {
8641 /*
8642 * In the CPU_NEWLY_IDLE, CPU_NOT_IDLE cases, use
8643 * imbalance_pct to be conservative.
8644 */
8645 if (100 * busiest->avg_load <=
8646 env->sd->imbalance_pct * local->avg_load)
8647 goto out_balanced;
8648 }
8649
8650force_balance:
8651 /* Looks like there is an imbalance. Compute it */
8652 calculate_imbalance(env, &sds);
8653 return sds.busiest;
8654
8655out_balanced:
8656 env->imbalance = 0;
8657 return NULL;
8658}
8659
8660/*
8661 * find_busiest_queue - find the busiest runqueue among the CPUs in the group.
8662 */
8663static struct rq *find_busiest_queue(struct lb_env *env,
8664 struct sched_group *group)
8665{
8666 struct rq *busiest = NULL, *rq;
8667 unsigned long busiest_load = 0, busiest_capacity = 1;
8668 int i;
8669
8670 for_each_cpu_and(i, sched_group_span(group), env->cpus) {
8671 unsigned long capacity, wl;
8672 enum fbq_type rt;
8673
8674 rq = cpu_rq(i);
8675 rt = fbq_classify_rq(rq);
8676
8677 /*
8678 * We classify groups/runqueues into three groups:
8679 * - regular: there are !numa tasks
8680 * - remote: there are numa tasks that run on the 'wrong' node
8681 * - all: there is no distinction
8682 *
8683 * In order to avoid migrating ideally placed numa tasks,
8684 * ignore those when there's better options.
8685 *
8686 * If we ignore the actual busiest queue to migrate another
8687 * task, the next balance pass can still reduce the busiest
8688 * queue by moving tasks around inside the node.
8689 *
8690 * If we cannot move enough load due to this classification
8691 * the next pass will adjust the group classification and
8692 * allow migration of more tasks.
8693 *
8694 * Both cases only affect the total convergence complexity.
8695 */
8696 if (rt > env->fbq_type)
8697 continue;
8698
8699 capacity = capacity_of(i);
8700
8701 wl = weighted_cpuload(rq);
8702
8703 /*
8704 * When comparing with imbalance, use weighted_cpuload()
8705 * which is not scaled with the CPU capacity.
8706 */
8707
8708 if (rq->nr_running == 1 && wl > env->imbalance &&
8709 !check_cpu_capacity(rq, env->sd))
8710 continue;
8711
8712 /*
8713 * For the load comparisons with the other CPU's, consider
8714 * the weighted_cpuload() scaled with the CPU capacity, so
8715 * that the load can be moved away from the CPU that is
8716 * potentially running at a lower capacity.
8717 *
8718 * Thus we're looking for max(wl_i / capacity_i), crosswise
8719 * multiplication to rid ourselves of the division works out
8720 * to: wl_i * capacity_j > wl_j * capacity_i; where j is
8721 * our previous maximum.
8722 */
8723 if (wl * busiest_capacity > busiest_load * capacity) {
8724 busiest_load = wl;
8725 busiest_capacity = capacity;
8726 busiest = rq;
8727 }
8728 }
8729
8730 return busiest;
8731}
8732
8733/*
8734 * Max backoff if we encounter pinned tasks. Pretty arbitrary value, but
8735 * so long as it is large enough.
8736 */
8737#define MAX_PINNED_INTERVAL 512
8738
8739static int need_active_balance(struct lb_env *env)
8740{
8741 struct sched_domain *sd = env->sd;
8742
8743 if (env->idle == CPU_NEWLY_IDLE) {
8744
8745 /*
8746 * ASYM_PACKING needs to force migrate tasks from busy but
8747 * lower priority CPUs in order to pack all tasks in the
8748 * highest priority CPUs.
8749 */
8750 if ((sd->flags & SD_ASYM_PACKING) &&
8751 sched_asym_prefer(env->dst_cpu, env->src_cpu))
8752 return 1;
8753 }
8754
8755 /*
8756 * The dst_cpu is idle and the src_cpu CPU has only 1 CFS task.
8757 * It's worth migrating the task if the src_cpu's capacity is reduced
8758 * because of other sched_class or IRQs if more capacity stays
8759 * available on dst_cpu.
8760 */
8761 if ((env->idle != CPU_NOT_IDLE) &&
8762 (env->src_rq->cfs.h_nr_running == 1)) {
8763 if ((check_cpu_capacity(env->src_rq, sd)) &&
8764 (capacity_of(env->src_cpu)*sd->imbalance_pct < capacity_of(env->dst_cpu)*100))
8765 return 1;
8766 }
8767
8768 return unlikely(sd->nr_balance_failed > sd->cache_nice_tries+2);
8769}
8770
8771static int active_load_balance_cpu_stop(void *data);
8772
8773static int should_we_balance(struct lb_env *env)
8774{
8775 struct sched_group *sg = env->sd->groups;
8776 int cpu, balance_cpu = -1;
8777
8778 /*
8779 * Ensure the balancing environment is consistent; can happen
8780 * when the softirq triggers 'during' hotplug.
8781 */
8782 if (!cpumask_test_cpu(env->dst_cpu, env->cpus))
8783 return 0;
8784
8785 /*
8786 * In the newly idle case, we will allow all the CPUs
8787 * to do the newly idle load balance.
8788 */
8789 if (env->idle == CPU_NEWLY_IDLE)
8790 return 1;
8791
8792 /* Try to find first idle CPU */
8793 for_each_cpu_and(cpu, group_balance_mask(sg), env->cpus) {
8794 if (!idle_cpu(cpu))
8795 continue;
8796
8797 balance_cpu = cpu;
8798 break;
8799 }
8800
8801 if (balance_cpu == -1)
8802 balance_cpu = group_balance_cpu(sg);
8803
8804 /*
8805 * First idle CPU or the first CPU(busiest) in this sched group
8806 * is eligible for doing load balancing at this and above domains.
8807 */
8808 return balance_cpu == env->dst_cpu;
8809}
8810
8811/*
8812 * Check this_cpu to ensure it is balanced within domain. Attempt to move
8813 * tasks if there is an imbalance.
8814 */
8815static int load_balance(int this_cpu, struct rq *this_rq,
8816 struct sched_domain *sd, enum cpu_idle_type idle,
8817 int *continue_balancing)
8818{
8819 int ld_moved, cur_ld_moved, active_balance = 0;
8820 struct sched_domain *sd_parent = sd->parent;
8821 struct sched_group *group;
8822 struct rq *busiest;
8823 struct rq_flags rf;
8824 struct cpumask *cpus = this_cpu_cpumask_var_ptr(load_balance_mask);
8825
8826 struct lb_env env = {
8827 .sd = sd,
8828 .dst_cpu = this_cpu,
8829 .dst_rq = this_rq,
8830 .dst_grpmask = sched_group_span(sd->groups),
8831 .idle = idle,
8832 .loop_break = sched_nr_migrate_break,
8833 .cpus = cpus,
8834 .fbq_type = all,
8835 .tasks = LIST_HEAD_INIT(env.tasks),
8836 };
8837
8838 cpumask_and(cpus, sched_domain_span(sd), cpu_active_mask);
8839
8840 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_count[idle]);
8841
8842redo:
8843 if (!should_we_balance(&env)) {
8844 *continue_balancing = 0;
8845 goto out_balanced;
8846 }
8847
8848 group = find_busiest_group(&env);
8849 if (!group) {
8850 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_nobusyg[idle]);
8851 goto out_balanced;
8852 }
8853
8854 busiest = find_busiest_queue(&env, group);
8855 if (!busiest) {
8856 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_nobusyq[idle]);
8857 goto out_balanced;
8858 }
8859
8860 BUG_ON(busiest == env.dst_rq);
8861
8862 schedstat_add(sd->lb_imbalance[idle], env.imbalance);
8863
8864 env.src_cpu = busiest->cpu;
8865 env.src_rq = busiest;
8866
8867 ld_moved = 0;
8868 if (busiest->nr_running > 1) {
8869 /*
8870 * Attempt to move tasks. If find_busiest_group has found
8871 * an imbalance but busiest->nr_running <= 1, the group is
8872 * still unbalanced. ld_moved simply stays zero, so it is
8873 * correctly treated as an imbalance.
8874 */
8875 env.flags |= LBF_ALL_PINNED;
8876 env.loop_max = min(sysctl_sched_nr_migrate, busiest->nr_running);
8877
8878more_balance:
8879 rq_lock_irqsave(busiest, &rf);
8880 update_rq_clock(busiest);
8881
8882 /*
8883 * cur_ld_moved - load moved in current iteration
8884 * ld_moved - cumulative load moved across iterations
8885 */
8886 cur_ld_moved = detach_tasks(&env);
8887
8888 /*
8889 * We've detached some tasks from busiest_rq. Every
8890 * task is masked "TASK_ON_RQ_MIGRATING", so we can safely
8891 * unlock busiest->lock, and we are able to be sure
8892 * that nobody can manipulate the tasks in parallel.
8893 * See task_rq_lock() family for the details.
8894 */
8895
8896 rq_unlock(busiest, &rf);
8897
8898 if (cur_ld_moved) {
8899 attach_tasks(&env);
8900 ld_moved += cur_ld_moved;
8901 }
8902
8903 local_irq_restore(rf.flags);
8904
8905 if (env.flags & LBF_NEED_BREAK) {
8906 env.flags &= ~LBF_NEED_BREAK;
8907 goto more_balance;
8908 }
8909
8910 /*
8911 * Revisit (affine) tasks on src_cpu that couldn't be moved to
8912 * us and move them to an alternate dst_cpu in our sched_group
8913 * where they can run. The upper limit on how many times we
8914 * iterate on same src_cpu is dependent on number of CPUs in our
8915 * sched_group.
8916 *
8917 * This changes load balance semantics a bit on who can move
8918 * load to a given_cpu. In addition to the given_cpu itself
8919 * (or a ilb_cpu acting on its behalf where given_cpu is
8920 * nohz-idle), we now have balance_cpu in a position to move
8921 * load to given_cpu. In rare situations, this may cause
8922 * conflicts (balance_cpu and given_cpu/ilb_cpu deciding
8923 * _independently_ and at _same_ time to move some load to
8924 * given_cpu) causing exceess load to be moved to given_cpu.
8925 * This however should not happen so much in practice and
8926 * moreover subsequent load balance cycles should correct the
8927 * excess load moved.
8928 */
8929 if ((env.flags & LBF_DST_PINNED) && env.imbalance > 0) {
8930
8931 /* Prevent to re-select dst_cpu via env's CPUs */
8932 cpumask_clear_cpu(env.dst_cpu, env.cpus);
8933
8934 env.dst_rq = cpu_rq(env.new_dst_cpu);
8935 env.dst_cpu = env.new_dst_cpu;
8936 env.flags &= ~LBF_DST_PINNED;
8937 env.loop = 0;
8938 env.loop_break = sched_nr_migrate_break;
8939
8940 /*
8941 * Go back to "more_balance" rather than "redo" since we
8942 * need to continue with same src_cpu.
8943 */
8944 goto more_balance;
8945 }
8946
8947 /*
8948 * We failed to reach balance because of affinity.
8949 */
8950 if (sd_parent) {
8951 int *group_imbalance = &sd_parent->groups->sgc->imbalance;
8952
8953 if ((env.flags & LBF_SOME_PINNED) && env.imbalance > 0)
8954 *group_imbalance = 1;
8955 }
8956
8957 /* All tasks on this runqueue were pinned by CPU affinity */
8958 if (unlikely(env.flags & LBF_ALL_PINNED)) {
8959 cpumask_clear_cpu(cpu_of(busiest), cpus);
8960 /*
8961 * Attempting to continue load balancing at the current
8962 * sched_domain level only makes sense if there are
8963 * active CPUs remaining as possible busiest CPUs to
8964 * pull load from which are not contained within the
8965 * destination group that is receiving any migrated
8966 * load.
8967 */
8968 if (!cpumask_subset(cpus, env.dst_grpmask)) {
8969 env.loop = 0;
8970 env.loop_break = sched_nr_migrate_break;
8971 goto redo;
8972 }
8973 goto out_all_pinned;
8974 }
8975 }
8976
8977 if (!ld_moved) {
8978 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_failed[idle]);
8979 /*
8980 * Increment the failure counter only on periodic balance.
8981 * We do not want newidle balance, which can be very
8982 * frequent, pollute the failure counter causing
8983 * excessive cache_hot migrations and active balances.
8984 */
8985 if (idle != CPU_NEWLY_IDLE)
8986 sd->nr_balance_failed++;
8987
8988 if (need_active_balance(&env)) {
8989 unsigned long flags;
8990
8991 raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&busiest->lock, flags);
8992
8993 /*
8994 * Don't kick the active_load_balance_cpu_stop,
8995 * if the curr task on busiest CPU can't be
8996 * moved to this_cpu:
8997 */
8998 if (!cpumask_test_cpu(this_cpu, &busiest->curr->cpus_allowed)) {
8999 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&busiest->lock,
9000 flags);
9001 env.flags |= LBF_ALL_PINNED;
9002 goto out_one_pinned;
9003 }
9004
9005 /*
9006 * ->active_balance synchronizes accesses to
9007 * ->active_balance_work. Once set, it's cleared
9008 * only after active load balance is finished.
9009 */
9010 if (!busiest->active_balance) {
9011 busiest->active_balance = 1;
9012 busiest->push_cpu = this_cpu;
9013 active_balance = 1;
9014 }
9015 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&busiest->lock, flags);
9016
9017 if (active_balance) {
9018 stop_one_cpu_nowait(cpu_of(busiest),
9019 active_load_balance_cpu_stop, busiest,
9020 &busiest->active_balance_work);
9021 }
9022
9023 /* We've kicked active balancing, force task migration. */
9024 sd->nr_balance_failed = sd->cache_nice_tries+1;
9025 }
9026 } else
9027 sd->nr_balance_failed = 0;
9028
9029 if (likely(!active_balance)) {
9030 /* We were unbalanced, so reset the balancing interval */
9031 sd->balance_interval = sd->min_interval;
9032 } else {
9033 /*
9034 * If we've begun active balancing, start to back off. This
9035 * case may not be covered by the all_pinned logic if there
9036 * is only 1 task on the busy runqueue (because we don't call
9037 * detach_tasks).
9038 */
9039 if (sd->balance_interval < sd->max_interval)
9040 sd->balance_interval *= 2;
9041 }
9042
9043 goto out;
9044
9045out_balanced:
9046 /*
9047 * We reach balance although we may have faced some affinity
9048 * constraints. Clear the imbalance flag if it was set.
9049 */
9050 if (sd_parent) {
9051 int *group_imbalance = &sd_parent->groups->sgc->imbalance;
9052
9053 if (*group_imbalance)
9054 *group_imbalance = 0;
9055 }
9056
9057out_all_pinned:
9058 /*
9059 * We reach balance because all tasks are pinned at this level so
9060 * we can't migrate them. Let the imbalance flag set so parent level
9061 * can try to migrate them.
9062 */
9063 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_balanced[idle]);
9064
9065 sd->nr_balance_failed = 0;
9066
9067out_one_pinned:
9068 /* tune up the balancing interval */
9069 if (((env.flags & LBF_ALL_PINNED) &&
9070 sd->balance_interval < MAX_PINNED_INTERVAL) ||
9071 (sd->balance_interval < sd->max_interval))
9072 sd->balance_interval *= 2;
9073
9074 ld_moved = 0;
9075out:
9076 return ld_moved;
9077}
9078
9079static inline unsigned long
9080get_sd_balance_interval(struct sched_domain *sd, int cpu_busy)
9081{
9082 unsigned long interval = sd->balance_interval;
9083
9084 if (cpu_busy)
9085 interval *= sd->busy_factor;
9086
9087 /* scale ms to jiffies */
9088 interval = msecs_to_jiffies(interval);
9089 interval = clamp(interval, 1UL, max_load_balance_interval);
9090
9091 return interval;
9092}
9093
9094static inline void
9095update_next_balance(struct sched_domain *sd, unsigned long *next_balance)
9096{
9097 unsigned long interval, next;
9098
9099 /* used by idle balance, so cpu_busy = 0 */
9100 interval = get_sd_balance_interval(sd, 0);
9101 next = sd->last_balance + interval;
9102
9103 if (time_after(*next_balance, next))
9104 *next_balance = next;
9105}
9106
9107/*
9108 * active_load_balance_cpu_stop is run by the CPU stopper. It pushes
9109 * running tasks off the busiest CPU onto idle CPUs. It requires at
9110 * least 1 task to be running on each physical CPU where possible, and
9111 * avoids physical / logical imbalances.
9112 */
9113static int active_load_balance_cpu_stop(void *data)
9114{
9115 struct rq *busiest_rq = data;
9116 int busiest_cpu = cpu_of(busiest_rq);
9117 int target_cpu = busiest_rq->push_cpu;
9118 struct rq *target_rq = cpu_rq(target_cpu);
9119 struct sched_domain *sd;
9120 struct task_struct *p = NULL;
9121 struct rq_flags rf;
9122
9123 rq_lock_irq(busiest_rq, &rf);
9124 /*
9125 * Between queueing the stop-work and running it is a hole in which
9126 * CPUs can become inactive. We should not move tasks from or to
9127 * inactive CPUs.
9128 */
9129 if (!cpu_active(busiest_cpu) || !cpu_active(target_cpu))
9130 goto out_unlock;
9131
9132 /* Make sure the requested CPU hasn't gone down in the meantime: */
9133 if (unlikely(busiest_cpu != smp_processor_id() ||
9134 !busiest_rq->active_balance))
9135 goto out_unlock;
9136
9137 /* Is there any task to move? */
9138 if (busiest_rq->nr_running <= 1)
9139 goto out_unlock;
9140
9141 /*
9142 * This condition is "impossible", if it occurs
9143 * we need to fix it. Originally reported by
9144 * Bjorn Helgaas on a 128-CPU setup.
9145 */
9146 BUG_ON(busiest_rq == target_rq);
9147
9148 /* Search for an sd spanning us and the target CPU. */
9149 rcu_read_lock();
9150 for_each_domain(target_cpu, sd) {
9151 if ((sd->flags & SD_LOAD_BALANCE) &&
9152 cpumask_test_cpu(busiest_cpu, sched_domain_span(sd)))
9153 break;
9154 }
9155
9156 if (likely(sd)) {
9157 struct lb_env env = {
9158 .sd = sd,
9159 .dst_cpu = target_cpu,
9160 .dst_rq = target_rq,
9161 .src_cpu = busiest_rq->cpu,
9162 .src_rq = busiest_rq,
9163 .idle = CPU_IDLE,
9164 /*
9165 * can_migrate_task() doesn't need to compute new_dst_cpu
9166 * for active balancing. Since we have CPU_IDLE, but no
9167 * @dst_grpmask we need to make that test go away with lying
9168 * about DST_PINNED.
9169 */
9170 .flags = LBF_DST_PINNED,
9171 };
9172
9173 schedstat_inc(sd->alb_count);
9174 update_rq_clock(busiest_rq);
9175
9176 p = detach_one_task(&env);
9177 if (p) {
9178 schedstat_inc(sd->alb_pushed);
9179 /* Active balancing done, reset the failure counter. */
9180 sd->nr_balance_failed = 0;
9181 } else {
9182 schedstat_inc(sd->alb_failed);
9183 }
9184 }
9185 rcu_read_unlock();
9186out_unlock:
9187 busiest_rq->active_balance = 0;
9188 rq_unlock(busiest_rq, &rf);
9189
9190 if (p)
9191 attach_one_task(target_rq, p);
9192
9193 local_irq_enable();
9194
9195 return 0;
9196}
9197
9198static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(balancing);
9199
9200/*
9201 * Scale the max load_balance interval with the number of CPUs in the system.
9202 * This trades load-balance latency on larger machines for less cross talk.
9203 */
9204void update_max_interval(void)
9205{
9206 max_load_balance_interval = HZ*num_online_cpus()/10;
9207}
9208
9209/*
9210 * It checks each scheduling domain to see if it is due to be balanced,
9211 * and initiates a balancing operation if so.
9212 *
9213 * Balancing parameters are set up in init_sched_domains.
9214 */
9215static void rebalance_domains(struct rq *rq, enum cpu_idle_type idle)
9216{
9217 int continue_balancing = 1;
9218 int cpu = rq->cpu;
9219 unsigned long interval;
9220 struct sched_domain *sd;
9221 /* Earliest time when we have to do rebalance again */
9222 unsigned long next_balance = jiffies + 60*HZ;
9223 int update_next_balance = 0;
9224 int need_serialize, need_decay = 0;
9225 u64 max_cost = 0;
9226
9227 rcu_read_lock();
9228 for_each_domain(cpu, sd) {
9229 /*
9230 * Decay the newidle max times here because this is a regular
9231 * visit to all the domains. Decay ~1% per second.
9232 */
9233 if (time_after(jiffies, sd->next_decay_max_lb_cost)) {
9234 sd->max_newidle_lb_cost =
9235 (sd->max_newidle_lb_cost * 253) / 256;
9236 sd->next_decay_max_lb_cost = jiffies + HZ;
9237 need_decay = 1;
9238 }
9239 max_cost += sd->max_newidle_lb_cost;
9240
9241 if (!(sd->flags & SD_LOAD_BALANCE))
9242 continue;
9243
9244 /*
9245 * Stop the load balance at this level. There is another
9246 * CPU in our sched group which is doing load balancing more
9247 * actively.
9248 */
9249 if (!continue_balancing) {
9250 if (need_decay)
9251 continue;
9252 break;
9253 }
9254
9255 interval = get_sd_balance_interval(sd, idle != CPU_IDLE);
9256
9257 need_serialize = sd->flags & SD_SERIALIZE;
9258 if (need_serialize) {
9259 if (!spin_trylock(&balancing))
9260 goto out;
9261 }
9262
9263 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, sd->last_balance + interval)) {
9264 if (load_balance(cpu, rq, sd, idle, &continue_balancing)) {
9265 /*
9266 * The LBF_DST_PINNED logic could have changed
9267 * env->dst_cpu, so we can't know our idle
9268 * state even if we migrated tasks. Update it.
9269 */
9270 idle = idle_cpu(cpu) ? CPU_IDLE : CPU_NOT_IDLE;
9271 }
9272 sd->last_balance = jiffies;
9273 interval = get_sd_balance_interval(sd, idle != CPU_IDLE);
9274 }
9275 if (need_serialize)
9276 spin_unlock(&balancing);
9277out:
9278 if (time_after(next_balance, sd->last_balance + interval)) {
9279 next_balance = sd->last_balance + interval;
9280 update_next_balance = 1;
9281 }
9282 }
9283 if (need_decay) {
9284 /*
9285 * Ensure the rq-wide value also decays but keep it at a
9286 * reasonable floor to avoid funnies with rq->avg_idle.
9287 */
9288 rq->max_idle_balance_cost =
9289 max((u64)sysctl_sched_migration_cost, max_cost);
9290 }
9291 rcu_read_unlock();
9292
9293 /*
9294 * next_balance will be updated only when there is a need.
9295 * When the cpu is attached to null domain for ex, it will not be
9296 * updated.
9297 */
9298 if (likely(update_next_balance)) {
9299 rq->next_balance = next_balance;
9300
9301#ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
9302 /*
9303 * If this CPU has been elected to perform the nohz idle
9304 * balance. Other idle CPUs have already rebalanced with
9305 * nohz_idle_balance() and nohz.next_balance has been
9306 * updated accordingly. This CPU is now running the idle load
9307 * balance for itself and we need to update the
9308 * nohz.next_balance accordingly.
9309 */
9310 if ((idle == CPU_IDLE) && time_after(nohz.next_balance, rq->next_balance))
9311 nohz.next_balance = rq->next_balance;
9312#endif
9313 }
9314}
9315
9316static inline int on_null_domain(struct rq *rq)
9317{
9318 return unlikely(!rcu_dereference_sched(rq->sd));
9319}
9320
9321#ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
9322/*
9323 * idle load balancing details
9324 * - When one of the busy CPUs notice that there may be an idle rebalancing
9325 * needed, they will kick the idle load balancer, which then does idle
9326 * load balancing for all the idle CPUs.
9327 */
9328
9329static inline int find_new_ilb(void)
9330{
9331 int ilb = cpumask_first(nohz.idle_cpus_mask);
9332
9333 if (ilb < nr_cpu_ids && idle_cpu(ilb))
9334 return ilb;
9335
9336 return nr_cpu_ids;
9337}
9338
9339/*
9340 * Kick a CPU to do the nohz balancing, if it is time for it. We pick the
9341 * nohz_load_balancer CPU (if there is one) otherwise fallback to any idle
9342 * CPU (if there is one).
9343 */
9344static void kick_ilb(unsigned int flags)
9345{
9346 int ilb_cpu;
9347
9348 nohz.next_balance++;
9349
9350 ilb_cpu = find_new_ilb();
9351
9352 if (ilb_cpu >= nr_cpu_ids)
9353 return;
9354
9355 flags = atomic_fetch_or(flags, nohz_flags(ilb_cpu));
9356 if (flags & NOHZ_KICK_MASK)
9357 return;
9358
9359 /*
9360 * Use smp_send_reschedule() instead of resched_cpu().
9361 * This way we generate a sched IPI on the target CPU which
9362 * is idle. And the softirq performing nohz idle load balance
9363 * will be run before returning from the IPI.
9364 */
9365 smp_send_reschedule(ilb_cpu);
9366}
9367
9368/*
9369 * Current heuristic for kicking the idle load balancer in the presence
9370 * of an idle cpu in the system.
9371 * - This rq has more than one task.
9372 * - This rq has at least one CFS task and the capacity of the CPU is
9373 * significantly reduced because of RT tasks or IRQs.
9374 * - At parent of LLC scheduler domain level, this cpu's scheduler group has
9375 * multiple busy cpu.
9376 * - For SD_ASYM_PACKING, if the lower numbered cpu's in the scheduler
9377 * domain span are idle.
9378 */
9379static void nohz_balancer_kick(struct rq *rq)
9380{
9381 unsigned long now = jiffies;
9382 struct sched_domain_shared *sds;
9383 struct sched_domain *sd;
9384 int nr_busy, i, cpu = rq->cpu;
9385 unsigned int flags = 0;
9386
9387 if (unlikely(rq->idle_balance))
9388 return;
9389
9390 /*
9391 * We may be recently in ticked or tickless idle mode. At the first
9392 * busy tick after returning from idle, we will update the busy stats.
9393 */
9394 nohz_balance_exit_idle(rq);
9395
9396 /*
9397 * None are in tickless mode and hence no need for NOHZ idle load
9398 * balancing.
9399 */
9400 if (likely(!atomic_read(&nohz.nr_cpus)))
9401 return;
9402
9403 if (READ_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked) &&
9404 time_after(now, READ_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked)))
9405 flags = NOHZ_STATS_KICK;
9406
9407 if (time_before(now, nohz.next_balance))
9408 goto out;
9409
9410 if (rq->nr_running >= 2) {
9411 flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
9412 goto out;
9413 }
9414
9415 rcu_read_lock();
9416 sds = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc_shared, cpu));
9417 if (sds) {
9418 /*
9419 * XXX: write a coherent comment on why we do this.
9420 * See also: http://lkml.kernel.org/r/20111202010832.602203411@sbsiddha-desk.sc.intel.com
9421 */
9422 nr_busy = atomic_read(&sds->nr_busy_cpus);
9423 if (nr_busy > 1) {
9424 flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
9425 goto unlock;
9426 }
9427
9428 }
9429
9430 sd = rcu_dereference(rq->sd);
9431 if (sd) {
9432 if ((rq->cfs.h_nr_running >= 1) &&
9433 check_cpu_capacity(rq, sd)) {
9434 flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
9435 goto unlock;
9436 }
9437 }
9438
9439 sd = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_asym, cpu));
9440 if (sd) {
9441 for_each_cpu(i, sched_domain_span(sd)) {
9442 if (i == cpu ||
9443 !cpumask_test_cpu(i, nohz.idle_cpus_mask))
9444 continue;
9445
9446 if (sched_asym_prefer(i, cpu)) {
9447 flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
9448 goto unlock;
9449 }
9450 }
9451 }
9452unlock:
9453 rcu_read_unlock();
9454out:
9455 if (flags)
9456 kick_ilb(flags);
9457}
9458
9459static void set_cpu_sd_state_busy(int cpu)
9460{
9461 struct sched_domain *sd;
9462
9463 rcu_read_lock();
9464 sd = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc, cpu));
9465
9466 if (!sd || !sd->nohz_idle)
9467 goto unlock;
9468 sd->nohz_idle = 0;
9469
9470 atomic_inc(&sd->shared->nr_busy_cpus);
9471unlock:
9472 rcu_read_unlock();
9473}
9474
9475void nohz_balance_exit_idle(struct rq *rq)
9476{
9477 SCHED_WARN_ON(rq != this_rq());
9478
9479 if (likely(!rq->nohz_tick_stopped))
9480 return;
9481
9482 rq->nohz_tick_stopped = 0;
9483 cpumask_clear_cpu(rq->cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask);
9484 atomic_dec(&nohz.nr_cpus);
9485
9486 set_cpu_sd_state_busy(rq->cpu);
9487}
9488
9489static void set_cpu_sd_state_idle(int cpu)
9490{
9491 struct sched_domain *sd;
9492
9493 rcu_read_lock();
9494 sd = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc, cpu));
9495
9496 if (!sd || sd->nohz_idle)
9497 goto unlock;
9498 sd->nohz_idle = 1;
9499
9500 atomic_dec(&sd->shared->nr_busy_cpus);
9501unlock:
9502 rcu_read_unlock();
9503}
9504
9505/*
9506 * This routine will record that the CPU is going idle with tick stopped.
9507 * This info will be used in performing idle load balancing in the future.
9508 */
9509void nohz_balance_enter_idle(int cpu)
9510{
9511 struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
9512
9513 SCHED_WARN_ON(cpu != smp_processor_id());
9514
9515 /* If this CPU is going down, then nothing needs to be done: */
9516 if (!cpu_active(cpu))
9517 return;
9518
9519 /* Spare idle load balancing on CPUs that don't want to be disturbed: */
9520 if (!housekeeping_cpu(cpu, HK_FLAG_SCHED))
9521 return;
9522
9523 /*
9524 * Can be set safely without rq->lock held
9525 * If a clear happens, it will have evaluated last additions because
9526 * rq->lock is held during the check and the clear
9527 */
9528 rq->has_blocked_load = 1;
9529
9530 /*
9531 * The tick is still stopped but load could have been added in the
9532 * meantime. We set the nohz.has_blocked flag to trig a check of the
9533 * *_avg. The CPU is already part of nohz.idle_cpus_mask so the clear
9534 * of nohz.has_blocked can only happen after checking the new load
9535 */
9536 if (rq->nohz_tick_stopped)
9537 goto out;
9538
9539 /* If we're a completely isolated CPU, we don't play: */
9540 if (on_null_domain(rq))
9541 return;
9542
9543 rq->nohz_tick_stopped = 1;
9544
9545 cpumask_set_cpu(cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask);
9546 atomic_inc(&nohz.nr_cpus);
9547
9548 /*
9549 * Ensures that if nohz_idle_balance() fails to observe our
9550 * @idle_cpus_mask store, it must observe the @has_blocked
9551 * store.
9552 */
9553 smp_mb__after_atomic();
9554
9555 set_cpu_sd_state_idle(cpu);
9556
9557out:
9558 /*
9559 * Each time a cpu enter idle, we assume that it has blocked load and
9560 * enable the periodic update of the load of idle cpus
9561 */
9562 WRITE_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked, 1);
9563}
9564
9565/*
9566 * Internal function that runs load balance for all idle cpus. The load balance
9567 * can be a simple update of blocked load or a complete load balance with
9568 * tasks movement depending of flags.
9569 * The function returns false if the loop has stopped before running
9570 * through all idle CPUs.
9571 */
9572static bool _nohz_idle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, unsigned int flags,
9573 enum cpu_idle_type idle)
9574{
9575 /* Earliest time when we have to do rebalance again */
9576 unsigned long now = jiffies;
9577 unsigned long next_balance = now + 60*HZ;
9578 bool has_blocked_load = false;
9579 int update_next_balance = 0;
9580 int this_cpu = this_rq->cpu;
9581 int balance_cpu;
9582 int ret = false;
9583 struct rq *rq;
9584
9585 SCHED_WARN_ON((flags & NOHZ_KICK_MASK) == NOHZ_BALANCE_KICK);
9586
9587 /*
9588 * We assume there will be no idle load after this update and clear
9589 * the has_blocked flag. If a cpu enters idle in the mean time, it will
9590 * set the has_blocked flag and trig another update of idle load.
9591 * Because a cpu that becomes idle, is added to idle_cpus_mask before
9592 * setting the flag, we are sure to not clear the state and not
9593 * check the load of an idle cpu.
9594 */
9595 WRITE_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked, 0);
9596
9597 /*
9598 * Ensures that if we miss the CPU, we must see the has_blocked
9599 * store from nohz_balance_enter_idle().
9600 */
9601 smp_mb();
9602
9603 for_each_cpu(balance_cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask) {
9604 if (balance_cpu == this_cpu || !idle_cpu(balance_cpu))
9605 continue;
9606
9607 /*
9608 * If this CPU gets work to do, stop the load balancing
9609 * work being done for other CPUs. Next load
9610 * balancing owner will pick it up.
9611 */
9612 if (need_resched()) {
9613 has_blocked_load = true;
9614 goto abort;
9615 }
9616
9617 rq = cpu_rq(balance_cpu);
9618
9619 has_blocked_load |= update_nohz_stats(rq, true);
9620
9621 /*
9622 * If time for next balance is due,
9623 * do the balance.
9624 */
9625 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, rq->next_balance)) {
9626 struct rq_flags rf;
9627
9628 rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
9629 update_rq_clock(rq);
9630 cpu_load_update_idle(rq);
9631 rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
9632
9633 if (flags & NOHZ_BALANCE_KICK)
9634 rebalance_domains(rq, CPU_IDLE);
9635 }
9636
9637 if (time_after(next_balance, rq->next_balance)) {
9638 next_balance = rq->next_balance;
9639 update_next_balance = 1;
9640 }
9641 }
9642
9643 /* Newly idle CPU doesn't need an update */
9644 if (idle != CPU_NEWLY_IDLE) {
9645 update_blocked_averages(this_cpu);
9646 has_blocked_load |= this_rq->has_blocked_load;
9647 }
9648
9649 if (flags & NOHZ_BALANCE_KICK)
9650 rebalance_domains(this_rq, CPU_IDLE);
9651
9652 WRITE_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked,
9653 now + msecs_to_jiffies(LOAD_AVG_PERIOD));
9654
9655 /* The full idle balance loop has been done */
9656 ret = true;
9657
9658abort:
9659 /* There is still blocked load, enable periodic update */
9660 if (has_blocked_load)
9661 WRITE_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked, 1);
9662
9663 /*
9664 * next_balance will be updated only when there is a need.
9665 * When the CPU is attached to null domain for ex, it will not be
9666 * updated.
9667 */
9668 if (likely(update_next_balance))
9669 nohz.next_balance = next_balance;
9670
9671 return ret;
9672}
9673
9674/*
9675 * In CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON case, the idle balance kickee will do the
9676 * rebalancing for all the cpus for whom scheduler ticks are stopped.
9677 */
9678static bool nohz_idle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, enum cpu_idle_type idle)
9679{
9680 int this_cpu = this_rq->cpu;
9681 unsigned int flags;
9682
9683 if (!(atomic_read(nohz_flags(this_cpu)) & NOHZ_KICK_MASK))
9684 return false;
9685
9686 if (idle != CPU_IDLE) {
9687 atomic_andnot(NOHZ_KICK_MASK, nohz_flags(this_cpu));
9688 return false;
9689 }
9690
9691 /*
9692 * barrier, pairs with nohz_balance_enter_idle(), ensures ...
9693 */
9694 flags = atomic_fetch_andnot(NOHZ_KICK_MASK, nohz_flags(this_cpu));
9695 if (!(flags & NOHZ_KICK_MASK))
9696 return false;
9697
9698 _nohz_idle_balance(this_rq, flags, idle);
9699
9700 return true;
9701}
9702
9703static void nohz_newidle_balance(struct rq *this_rq)
9704{
9705 int this_cpu = this_rq->cpu;
9706
9707 /*
9708 * This CPU doesn't want to be disturbed by scheduler
9709 * housekeeping
9710 */
9711 if (!housekeeping_cpu(this_cpu, HK_FLAG_SCHED))
9712 return;
9713
9714 /* Will wake up very soon. No time for doing anything else*/
9715 if (this_rq->avg_idle < sysctl_sched_migration_cost)
9716 return;
9717
9718 /* Don't need to update blocked load of idle CPUs*/
9719 if (!READ_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked) ||
9720 time_before(jiffies, READ_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked)))
9721 return;
9722
9723 raw_spin_unlock(&this_rq->lock);
9724 /*
9725 * This CPU is going to be idle and blocked load of idle CPUs
9726 * need to be updated. Run the ilb locally as it is a good
9727 * candidate for ilb instead of waking up another idle CPU.
9728 * Kick an normal ilb if we failed to do the update.
9729 */
9730 if (!_nohz_idle_balance(this_rq, NOHZ_STATS_KICK, CPU_NEWLY_IDLE))
9731 kick_ilb(NOHZ_STATS_KICK);
9732 raw_spin_lock(&this_rq->lock);
9733}
9734
9735#else /* !CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON */
9736static inline void nohz_balancer_kick(struct rq *rq) { }
9737
9738static inline bool nohz_idle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, enum cpu_idle_type idle)
9739{
9740 return false;
9741}
9742
9743static inline void nohz_newidle_balance(struct rq *this_rq) { }
9744#endif /* CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON */
9745
9746/*
9747 * idle_balance is called by schedule() if this_cpu is about to become
9748 * idle. Attempts to pull tasks from other CPUs.
9749 */
9750static int idle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, struct rq_flags *rf)
9751{
9752 unsigned long next_balance = jiffies + HZ;
9753 int this_cpu = this_rq->cpu;
9754 struct sched_domain *sd;
9755 int pulled_task = 0;
9756 u64 curr_cost = 0;
9757
9758 /*
9759 * We must set idle_stamp _before_ calling idle_balance(), such that we
9760 * measure the duration of idle_balance() as idle time.
9761 */
9762 this_rq->idle_stamp = rq_clock(this_rq);
9763
9764 /*
9765 * Do not pull tasks towards !active CPUs...
9766 */
9767 if (!cpu_active(this_cpu))
9768 return 0;
9769
9770 /*
9771 * This is OK, because current is on_cpu, which avoids it being picked
9772 * for load-balance and preemption/IRQs are still disabled avoiding
9773 * further scheduler activity on it and we're being very careful to
9774 * re-start the picking loop.
9775 */
9776 rq_unpin_lock(this_rq, rf);
9777
9778 if (this_rq->avg_idle < sysctl_sched_migration_cost ||
9779 !this_rq->rd->overload) {
9780
9781 rcu_read_lock();
9782 sd = rcu_dereference_check_sched_domain(this_rq->sd);
9783 if (sd)
9784 update_next_balance(sd, &next_balance);
9785 rcu_read_unlock();
9786
9787 nohz_newidle_balance(this_rq);
9788
9789 goto out;
9790 }
9791
9792 raw_spin_unlock(&this_rq->lock);
9793
9794 update_blocked_averages(this_cpu);
9795 rcu_read_lock();
9796 for_each_domain(this_cpu, sd) {
9797 int continue_balancing = 1;
9798 u64 t0, domain_cost;
9799
9800 if (!(sd->flags & SD_LOAD_BALANCE))
9801 continue;
9802
9803 if (this_rq->avg_idle < curr_cost + sd->max_newidle_lb_cost) {
9804 update_next_balance(sd, &next_balance);
9805 break;
9806 }
9807
9808 if (sd->flags & SD_BALANCE_NEWIDLE) {
9809 t0 = sched_clock_cpu(this_cpu);
9810
9811 pulled_task = load_balance(this_cpu, this_rq,
9812 sd, CPU_NEWLY_IDLE,
9813 &continue_balancing);
9814
9815 domain_cost = sched_clock_cpu(this_cpu) - t0;
9816 if (domain_cost > sd->max_newidle_lb_cost)
9817 sd->max_newidle_lb_cost = domain_cost;
9818
9819 curr_cost += domain_cost;
9820 }
9821
9822 update_next_balance(sd, &next_balance);
9823
9824 /*
9825 * Stop searching for tasks to pull if there are
9826 * now runnable tasks on this rq.
9827 */
9828 if (pulled_task || this_rq->nr_running > 0)
9829 break;
9830 }
9831 rcu_read_unlock();
9832
9833 raw_spin_lock(&this_rq->lock);
9834
9835 if (curr_cost > this_rq->max_idle_balance_cost)
9836 this_rq->max_idle_balance_cost = curr_cost;
9837
9838out:
9839 /*
9840 * While browsing the domains, we released the rq lock, a task could
9841 * have been enqueued in the meantime. Since we're not going idle,
9842 * pretend we pulled a task.
9843 */
9844 if (this_rq->cfs.h_nr_running && !pulled_task)
9845 pulled_task = 1;
9846
9847 /* Move the next balance forward */
9848 if (time_after(this_rq->next_balance, next_balance))
9849 this_rq->next_balance = next_balance;
9850
9851 /* Is there a task of a high priority class? */
9852 if (this_rq->nr_running != this_rq->cfs.h_nr_running)
9853 pulled_task = -1;
9854
9855 if (pulled_task)
9856 this_rq->idle_stamp = 0;
9857
9858 rq_repin_lock(this_rq, rf);
9859
9860 return pulled_task;
9861}
9862
9863/*
9864 * run_rebalance_domains is triggered when needed from the scheduler tick.
9865 * Also triggered for nohz idle balancing (with nohz_balancing_kick set).
9866 */
9867static __latent_entropy void run_rebalance_domains(struct softirq_action *h)
9868{
9869 struct rq *this_rq = this_rq();
9870 enum cpu_idle_type idle = this_rq->idle_balance ?
9871 CPU_IDLE : CPU_NOT_IDLE;
9872
9873 /*
9874 * If this CPU has a pending nohz_balance_kick, then do the
9875 * balancing on behalf of the other idle CPUs whose ticks are
9876 * stopped. Do nohz_idle_balance *before* rebalance_domains to
9877 * give the idle CPUs a chance to load balance. Else we may
9878 * load balance only within the local sched_domain hierarchy
9879 * and abort nohz_idle_balance altogether if we pull some load.
9880 */
9881 if (nohz_idle_balance(this_rq, idle))
9882 return;
9883
9884 /* normal load balance */
9885 update_blocked_averages(this_rq->cpu);
9886 rebalance_domains(this_rq, idle);
9887}
9888
9889/*
9890 * Trigger the SCHED_SOFTIRQ if it is time to do periodic load balancing.
9891 */
9892void trigger_load_balance(struct rq *rq)
9893{
9894 /* Don't need to rebalance while attached to NULL domain */
9895 if (unlikely(on_null_domain(rq)))
9896 return;
9897
9898 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, rq->next_balance))
9899 raise_softirq(SCHED_SOFTIRQ);
9900
9901 nohz_balancer_kick(rq);
9902}
9903
9904static void rq_online_fair(struct rq *rq)
9905{
9906 update_sysctl();
9907
9908 update_runtime_enabled(rq);
9909}
9910
9911static void rq_offline_fair(struct rq *rq)
9912{
9913 update_sysctl();
9914
9915 /* Ensure any throttled groups are reachable by pick_next_task */
9916 unthrottle_offline_cfs_rqs(rq);
9917}
9918
9919#endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
9920
9921/*
9922 * scheduler tick hitting a task of our scheduling class.
9923 *
9924 * NOTE: This function can be called remotely by the tick offload that
9925 * goes along full dynticks. Therefore no local assumption can be made
9926 * and everything must be accessed through the @rq and @curr passed in
9927 * parameters.
9928 */
9929static void task_tick_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *curr, int queued)
9930{
9931 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
9932 struct sched_entity *se = &curr->se;
9933
9934 for_each_sched_entity(se) {
9935 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
9936 entity_tick(cfs_rq, se, queued);
9937 }
9938
9939 if (static_branch_unlikely(&sched_numa_balancing))
9940 task_tick_numa(rq, curr);
9941}
9942
9943/*
9944 * called on fork with the child task as argument from the parent's context
9945 * - child not yet on the tasklist
9946 * - preemption disabled
9947 */
9948static void task_fork_fair(struct task_struct *p)
9949{
9950 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
9951 struct sched_entity *se = &p->se, *curr;
9952 struct rq *rq = this_rq();
9953 struct rq_flags rf;
9954
9955 rq_lock(rq, &rf);
9956 update_rq_clock(rq);
9957
9958 cfs_rq = task_cfs_rq(current);
9959 curr = cfs_rq->curr;
9960 if (curr) {
9961 update_curr(cfs_rq);
9962 se->vruntime = curr->vruntime;
9963 }
9964 place_entity(cfs_rq, se, 1);
9965
9966 if (sysctl_sched_child_runs_first && curr && entity_before(curr, se)) {
9967 /*
9968 * Upon rescheduling, sched_class::put_prev_task() will place
9969 * 'current' within the tree based on its new key value.
9970 */
9971 swap(curr->vruntime, se->vruntime);
9972 resched_curr(rq);
9973 }
9974
9975 se->vruntime -= cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
9976 rq_unlock(rq, &rf);
9977}
9978
9979/*
9980 * Priority of the task has changed. Check to see if we preempt
9981 * the current task.
9982 */
9983static void
9984prio_changed_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p, int oldprio)
9985{
9986 if (!task_on_rq_queued(p))
9987 return;
9988
9989 /*
9990 * Reschedule if we are currently running on this runqueue and
9991 * our priority decreased, or if we are not currently running on
9992 * this runqueue and our priority is higher than the current's
9993 */
9994 if (rq->curr == p) {
9995 if (p->prio > oldprio)
9996 resched_curr(rq);
9997 } else
9998 check_preempt_curr(rq, p, 0);
9999}
10000
10001static inline bool vruntime_normalized(struct task_struct *p)
10002{
10003 struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
10004
10005 /*
10006 * In both the TASK_ON_RQ_QUEUED and TASK_ON_RQ_MIGRATING cases,
10007 * the dequeue_entity(.flags=0) will already have normalized the
10008 * vruntime.
10009 */
10010 if (p->on_rq)
10011 return true;
10012
10013 /*
10014 * When !on_rq, vruntime of the task has usually NOT been normalized.
10015 * But there are some cases where it has already been normalized:
10016 *
10017 * - A forked child which is waiting for being woken up by
10018 * wake_up_new_task().
10019 * - A task which has been woken up by try_to_wake_up() and
10020 * waiting for actually being woken up by sched_ttwu_pending().
10021 */
10022 if (!se->sum_exec_runtime ||
10023 (p->state == TASK_WAKING && p->sched_remote_wakeup))
10024 return true;
10025
10026 return false;
10027}
10028
10029#ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
10030/*
10031 * Propagate the changes of the sched_entity across the tg tree to make it
10032 * visible to the root
10033 */
10034static void propagate_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se)
10035{
10036 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
10037
10038 /* Start to propagate at parent */
10039 se = se->parent;
10040
10041 for_each_sched_entity(se) {
10042 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
10043
10044 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
10045 break;
10046
10047 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG);
10048 }
10049}
10050#else
10051static void propagate_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se) { }
10052#endif
10053
10054static void detach_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se)
10055{
10056 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
10057
10058 /* Catch up with the cfs_rq and remove our load when we leave */
10059 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, 0);
10060 detach_entity_load_avg(cfs_rq, se);
10061 update_tg_load_avg(cfs_rq, false);
10062 propagate_entity_cfs_rq(se);
10063}
10064
10065static void attach_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se)
10066{
10067 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
10068
10069#ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
10070 /*
10071 * Since the real-depth could have been changed (only FAIR
10072 * class maintain depth value), reset depth properly.
10073 */
10074 se->depth = se->parent ? se->parent->depth + 1 : 0;
10075#endif
10076
10077 /* Synchronize entity with its cfs_rq */
10078 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, sched_feat(ATTACH_AGE_LOAD) ? 0 : SKIP_AGE_LOAD);
10079 attach_entity_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, 0);
10080 update_tg_load_avg(cfs_rq, false);
10081 propagate_entity_cfs_rq(se);
10082}
10083
10084static void detach_task_cfs_rq(struct task_struct *p)
10085{
10086 struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
10087 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
10088
10089 if (!vruntime_normalized(p)) {
10090 /*
10091 * Fix up our vruntime so that the current sleep doesn't
10092 * cause 'unlimited' sleep bonus.
10093 */
10094 place_entity(cfs_rq, se, 0);
10095 se->vruntime -= cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
10096 }
10097
10098 detach_entity_cfs_rq(se);
10099}
10100
10101static void attach_task_cfs_rq(struct task_struct *p)
10102{
10103 struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
10104 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
10105
10106 attach_entity_cfs_rq(se);
10107
10108 if (!vruntime_normalized(p))
10109 se->vruntime += cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
10110}
10111
10112static void switched_from_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
10113{
10114 detach_task_cfs_rq(p);
10115}
10116
10117static void switched_to_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
10118{
10119 attach_task_cfs_rq(p);
10120
10121 if (task_on_rq_queued(p)) {
10122 /*
10123 * We were most likely switched from sched_rt, so
10124 * kick off the schedule if running, otherwise just see
10125 * if we can still preempt the current task.
10126 */
10127 if (rq->curr == p)
10128 resched_curr(rq);
10129 else
10130 check_preempt_curr(rq, p, 0);
10131 }
10132}
10133
10134/* Account for a task changing its policy or group.
10135 *
10136 * This routine is mostly called to set cfs_rq->curr field when a task
10137 * migrates between groups/classes.
10138 */
10139static void set_curr_task_fair(struct rq *rq)
10140{
10141 struct sched_entity *se = &rq->curr->se;
10142
10143 for_each_sched_entity(se) {
10144 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
10145
10146 set_next_entity(cfs_rq, se);
10147 /* ensure bandwidth has been allocated on our new cfs_rq */
10148 account_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq, 0);
10149 }
10150}
10151
10152void init_cfs_rq(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
10153{
10154 cfs_rq->tasks_timeline = RB_ROOT_CACHED;
10155 cfs_rq->min_vruntime = (u64)(-(1LL << 20));
10156#ifndef CONFIG_64BIT
10157 cfs_rq->min_vruntime_copy = cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
10158#endif
10159#ifdef CONFIG_SMP
10160 raw_spin_lock_init(&cfs_rq->removed.lock);
10161#endif
10162}
10163
10164#ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
10165static void task_set_group_fair(struct task_struct *p)
10166{
10167 struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
10168
10169 set_task_rq(p, task_cpu(p));
10170 se->depth = se->parent ? se->parent->depth + 1 : 0;
10171}
10172
10173static void task_move_group_fair(struct task_struct *p)
10174{
10175 detach_task_cfs_rq(p);
10176 set_task_rq(p, task_cpu(p));
10177
10178#ifdef CONFIG_SMP
10179 /* Tell se's cfs_rq has been changed -- migrated */
10180 p->se.avg.last_update_time = 0;
10181#endif
10182 attach_task_cfs_rq(p);
10183}
10184
10185static void task_change_group_fair(struct task_struct *p, int type)
10186{
10187 switch (type) {
10188 case TASK_SET_GROUP:
10189 task_set_group_fair(p);
10190 break;
10191
10192 case TASK_MOVE_GROUP:
10193 task_move_group_fair(p);
10194 break;
10195 }
10196}
10197
10198void free_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg)
10199{
10200 int i;
10201
10202 destroy_cfs_bandwidth(tg_cfs_bandwidth(tg));
10203
10204 for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
10205 if (tg->cfs_rq)
10206 kfree(tg->cfs_rq[i]);
10207 if (tg->se)
10208 kfree(tg->se[i]);
10209 }
10210
10211 kfree(tg->cfs_rq);
10212 kfree(tg->se);
10213}
10214
10215int alloc_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg, struct task_group *parent)
10216{
10217 struct sched_entity *se;
10218 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
10219 int i;
10220
10221 tg->cfs_rq = kcalloc(nr_cpu_ids, sizeof(cfs_rq), GFP_KERNEL);
10222 if (!tg->cfs_rq)
10223 goto err;
10224 tg->se = kcalloc(nr_cpu_ids, sizeof(se), GFP_KERNEL);
10225 if (!tg->se)
10226 goto err;
10227
10228 tg->shares = NICE_0_LOAD;
10229
10230 init_cfs_bandwidth(tg_cfs_bandwidth(tg));
10231
10232 for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
10233 cfs_rq = kzalloc_node(sizeof(struct cfs_rq),
10234 GFP_KERNEL, cpu_to_node(i));
10235 if (!cfs_rq)
10236 goto err;
10237
10238 se = kzalloc_node(sizeof(struct sched_entity),
10239 GFP_KERNEL, cpu_to_node(i));
10240 if (!se)
10241 goto err_free_rq;
10242
10243 init_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
10244 init_tg_cfs_entry(tg, cfs_rq, se, i, parent->se[i]);
10245 init_entity_runnable_average(se);
10246 }
10247
10248 return 1;
10249
10250err_free_rq:
10251 kfree(cfs_rq);
10252err:
10253 return 0;
10254}
10255
10256void online_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg)
10257{
10258 struct sched_entity *se;
10259 struct rq *rq;
10260 int i;
10261
10262 for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
10263 rq = cpu_rq(i);
10264 se = tg->se[i];
10265
10266 raw_spin_lock_irq(&rq->lock);
10267 update_rq_clock(rq);
10268 attach_entity_cfs_rq(se);
10269 sync_throttle(tg, i);
10270 raw_spin_unlock_irq(&rq->lock);
10271 }
10272}
10273
10274void unregister_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg)
10275{
10276 unsigned long flags;
10277 struct rq *rq;
10278 int cpu;
10279
10280 for_each_possible_cpu(cpu) {
10281 if (tg->se[cpu])
10282 remove_entity_load_avg(tg->se[cpu]);
10283
10284 /*
10285 * Only empty task groups can be destroyed; so we can speculatively
10286 * check on_list without danger of it being re-added.
10287 */
10288 if (!tg->cfs_rq[cpu]->on_list)
10289 continue;
10290
10291 rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
10292
10293 raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&rq->lock, flags);
10294 list_del_leaf_cfs_rq(tg->cfs_rq[cpu]);
10295 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&rq->lock, flags);
10296 }
10297}
10298
10299void init_tg_cfs_entry(struct task_group *tg, struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq,
10300 struct sched_entity *se, int cpu,
10301 struct sched_entity *parent)
10302{
10303 struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
10304
10305 cfs_rq->tg = tg;
10306 cfs_rq->rq = rq;
10307 init_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq);
10308
10309 tg->cfs_rq[cpu] = cfs_rq;
10310 tg->se[cpu] = se;
10311
10312 /* se could be NULL for root_task_group */
10313 if (!se)
10314 return;
10315
10316 if (!parent) {
10317 se->cfs_rq = &rq->cfs;
10318 se->depth = 0;
10319 } else {
10320 se->cfs_rq = parent->my_q;
10321 se->depth = parent->depth + 1;
10322 }
10323
10324 se->my_q = cfs_rq;
10325 /* guarantee group entities always have weight */
10326 update_load_set(&se->load, NICE_0_LOAD);
10327 se->parent = parent;
10328}
10329
10330static DEFINE_MUTEX(shares_mutex);
10331
10332int sched_group_set_shares(struct task_group *tg, unsigned long shares)
10333{
10334 int i;
10335
10336 /*
10337 * We can't change the weight of the root cgroup.
10338 */
10339 if (!tg->se[0])
10340 return -EINVAL;
10341
10342 shares = clamp(shares, scale_load(MIN_SHARES), scale_load(MAX_SHARES));
10343
10344 mutex_lock(&shares_mutex);
10345 if (tg->shares == shares)
10346 goto done;
10347
10348 tg->shares = shares;
10349 for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
10350 struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(i);
10351 struct sched_entity *se = tg->se[i];
10352 struct rq_flags rf;
10353
10354 /* Propagate contribution to hierarchy */
10355 rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
10356 update_rq_clock(rq);
10357 for_each_sched_entity(se) {
10358 update_load_avg(cfs_rq_of(se), se, UPDATE_TG);
10359 update_cfs_group(se);
10360 }
10361 rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
10362 }
10363
10364done:
10365 mutex_unlock(&shares_mutex);
10366 return 0;
10367}
10368#else /* CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED */
10369
10370void free_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg) { }
10371
10372int alloc_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg, struct task_group *parent)
10373{
10374 return 1;
10375}
10376
10377void online_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg) { }
10378
10379void unregister_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg) { }
10380
10381#endif /* CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED */
10382
10383
10384static unsigned int get_rr_interval_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *task)
10385{
10386 struct sched_entity *se = &task->se;
10387 unsigned int rr_interval = 0;
10388
10389 /*
10390 * Time slice is 0 for SCHED_OTHER tasks that are on an otherwise
10391 * idle runqueue:
10392 */
10393 if (rq->cfs.load.weight)
10394 rr_interval = NS_TO_JIFFIES(sched_slice(cfs_rq_of(se), se));
10395
10396 return rr_interval;
10397}
10398
10399/*
10400 * All the scheduling class methods:
10401 */
10402const struct sched_class fair_sched_class = {
10403 .next = &idle_sched_class,
10404 .enqueue_task = enqueue_task_fair,
10405 .dequeue_task = dequeue_task_fair,
10406 .yield_task = yield_task_fair,
10407 .yield_to_task = yield_to_task_fair,
10408
10409 .check_preempt_curr = check_preempt_wakeup,
10410
10411 .pick_next_task = pick_next_task_fair,
10412 .put_prev_task = put_prev_task_fair,
10413
10414#ifdef CONFIG_SMP
10415 .select_task_rq = select_task_rq_fair,
10416 .migrate_task_rq = migrate_task_rq_fair,
10417
10418 .rq_online = rq_online_fair,
10419 .rq_offline = rq_offline_fair,
10420
10421 .task_dead = task_dead_fair,
10422 .set_cpus_allowed = set_cpus_allowed_common,
10423#endif
10424
10425 .set_curr_task = set_curr_task_fair,
10426 .task_tick = task_tick_fair,
10427 .task_fork = task_fork_fair,
10428
10429 .prio_changed = prio_changed_fair,
10430 .switched_from = switched_from_fair,
10431 .switched_to = switched_to_fair,
10432
10433 .get_rr_interval = get_rr_interval_fair,
10434
10435 .update_curr = update_curr_fair,
10436
10437#ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
10438 .task_change_group = task_change_group_fair,
10439#endif
10440};
10441
10442#ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_DEBUG
10443void print_cfs_stats(struct seq_file *m, int cpu)
10444{
10445 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, *pos;
10446
10447 rcu_read_lock();
10448 for_each_leaf_cfs_rq_safe(cpu_rq(cpu), cfs_rq, pos)
10449 print_cfs_rq(m, cpu, cfs_rq);
10450 rcu_read_unlock();
10451}
10452
10453#ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
10454void show_numa_stats(struct task_struct *p, struct seq_file *m)
10455{
10456 int node;
10457 unsigned long tsf = 0, tpf = 0, gsf = 0, gpf = 0;
10458
10459 for_each_online_node(node) {
10460 if (p->numa_faults) {
10461 tsf = p->numa_faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 0)];
10462 tpf = p->numa_faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 1)];
10463 }
10464 if (p->numa_group) {
10465 gsf = p->numa_group->faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 0)],
10466 gpf = p->numa_group->faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 1)];
10467 }
10468 print_numa_stats(m, node, tsf, tpf, gsf, gpf);
10469 }
10470}
10471#endif /* CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING */
10472#endif /* CONFIG_SCHED_DEBUG */
10473
10474__init void init_sched_fair_class(void)
10475{
10476#ifdef CONFIG_SMP
10477 open_softirq(SCHED_SOFTIRQ, run_rebalance_domains);
10478
10479#ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
10480 nohz.next_balance = jiffies;
10481 nohz.next_blocked = jiffies;
10482 zalloc_cpumask_var(&nohz.idle_cpus_mask, GFP_NOWAIT);
10483#endif
10484#endif /* SMP */
10485
10486}
